ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team18

Class APIData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team18.Data
      • ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team18.APIData

  • public class APIData
extends Data
    The purpose of this class is to create objects that will access the Fitbit's API servers via Oauthentication 2 and will parse through the resulting JSON texts and store the various values for each of the object's attributes
    Author:
    Team 18 (Sam Ali-mirsalari)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void api(java.lang.String requestUrl)
      The api method is a private helper method that will access the Fitbit's API via OAuthentication and will store the JSON objects that are returned
      private void connectionError()
      Private method that will set all the attributes of the APIData object to invalid values
      private void createRequests(java.lang.String date)
      A helper method that will create the request urls and sent for the requests
      boolean isErrorConnection()
      Method that will return the value indicating wether there was a error connecting with the api
      private void readFiles()
      Private method that reads the credentials and tokens files in order to authenticate the users credentials and allow Fitbit information to be attained
      java.lang.String refresh(java.lang.String date)
      The refresh method will refresh the attributes of the APIData object with information and values from a different date
      private void save()
      private method that will store the values of the APIData object to a file so that the test mode has values
      private void setActivities()
      The setActivites method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Activity attributes.
      private void setBestLife()
      The setBestLife method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Best Dates and Total Life activities.
      private void setHeartRate()
      The setHeartRate method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Heart Rate information.
      private void setHRObject(HeartRateZone obj, JSONObject jsonObj)
      The setHRObject method is a private helper method that will pass in a Heart Rate Zone object to be filled as well as a JSONObject that will be used to extract the values that will fill the attributes.
      private void setRecentActivity()
      The setRecentActivity method is a private method that will parse through the current nresponse body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Heart Rate information This includes the 3 most recent activities and they will be stored into an array
      private void writeFiles()
      Private method that will write the new tokens to the tokens file

    • Constructor Detail

      • APIData

        public APIData(java.lang.String date)
        This constructor allows a date to be used as a parameter in order to access the Fitbit's API for a specific date
        Parameters:
        date - The String parameter date is used to choose the date that the APIData class will access from Fitbit API servers in order to fill the object's attributes

    • Method Detail

      • createRequests

        private void createRequests(java.lang.String date)
        A helper method that will create the request urls and sent for the requests
        Parameters:
        date - the string parameter date is used to choose the date that the api requests will access from Fitbit API servers

      • connectionError

        private void connectionError()
        Private method that will set all the attributes of the APIData object to invalid values

      • readFiles

        private void readFiles()
        Private method that reads the credentials and tokens files in order to authenticate the users credentials and allow Fitbit information to be attained

      • writeFiles

        private void writeFiles()
        Private method that will write the new tokens to the tokens file

      • save

        private void save()
        private method that will store the values of the APIData object to a file so that the test mode has values

      • api

        private void api(java.lang.String requestUrl)
        The api method is a private helper method that will access the Fitbit's API via OAuthentication and will store the JSON objects that are returned
        Parameters:
        requestUrl - The String parameter that stores the specific URL that the api method should access in order to store the JSON object that will contain the APIData's attributes

      • setActivities

        private void setActivities()
        The setActivites method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Activity attributes. This includes the attributes Calories Out, Floors, Steps, Active Minutes, Sedentary Minutes, and Distance

      • setBestLife

        private void setBestLife()
        The setBestLife method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Best Dates and Total Life activities. This includes the attributes Best Distance, Best Steps, Best Floors, Total Distance, Total Steps, and Total Floors

      • setHeartRate

        private void setHeartRate()
        The setHeartRate method is a private helper method that will parse through the current response body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Heart Rate information. This includes the attributes Resting Heart Rate, Out of Range Zone, Fat Burn Zone, Cardio Zone, and Peak Zone

      • setRecentActivity

        private void setRecentActivity()
        The setRecentActivity method is a private method that will parse through the current nresponse body that contains the JSON information for the APIData object's Heart Rate information This includes the 3 most recent activities and they will be stored into an array

      • setHRObject

        private void setHRObject(HeartRateZone obj,
                         JSONObject jsonObj)
        The setHRObject method is a private helper method that will pass in a Heart Rate Zone object to be filled as well as a JSONObject that will be used to extract the values that will fill the attributes.
        Parameters:
        obj - This parameter will be the HeartRateZone object to be filled with the values from the JSONObject
        jsonObj - This parameter will be the JSONObject that contains the JSON text that contains the appropriate values to be stored in the HeartRateZone object that is passed in

      • refresh

        public java.lang.String refresh(java.lang.String date)
        The refresh method will refresh the attributes of the APIData object with information and values from a different date
        Parameters:
        date - This parameter is a String which indicates the new date which should be now pulled from the Fitbit's API server
        Returns:
        The current time in the format of HH:mm:ss in order to indicate the time that a refresh for new information was requested

      • isErrorConnection

        public boolean isErrorConnection()
        Method that will return the value indicating wether there was a error connecting with the api
        Returns:
        errorConnection which is a boolean value that stores whether or not there was an api error
